Class Password_gen

java.lang.Object
com.password_generator.Password_gen
public class Password_gen extends Object
Class responsible for generating the password

  • Method Details

    • generate

      protected String generate(Object[] args)
      Function implementing password generation
      Parameters:
      args - Object array containing password generation parameters args[0] - boolean value: use numbers or not args[1] - boolean value: use upper case or not args[2] - boolean value: use special characters or not args[3] - boolean value: use Cyrillic characters or not args[4] - integer value: length of generating password args[5] - string value: string of elements user need to get in generated password
      Returns:
      generated password

    • include_check

      private void include_check(char[] symb_arr, int symb_arr_leng, int pass_leng, boolean need, boolean all)
      Function that checks whether a current password contains a character of the required type. If it does not, it inserts a random required character into a random place in the password
      Parameters:
      symb_arr - char array: array with required characters
      symb_arr_leng - integer value: length of array with required characters
      pass_leng - integer value: length of password
      need - boolean value: do user require symbols this type in password or not
      all - boolean value: is it required that all characters of this type be included in the password or not

    • merge

      private char[] merge(char[][] arrs)
      Function that implements the union of two arrays into one
      Parameters:
      arrs - two-dimensional char array: contains two char arrays that need to be merged
      Returns:
      array that includes all elements of two arrays from the argument

    • create_arr

      private void create_arr(Object[] args)
      Function that creates an array containing all the characters that will be used to generate a password
      Parameters:
      args - Object array containing password generation parameters args[0] - boolean value: use numbers or not args[1] - boolean value: use upper case or not args[2] - boolean value: use special characters or not args[3] - boolean value: use Cyrillic characters or not args[4] - integer value: length of generating password args[5] - string value: string of elements user need to get in generated password

    • correct_generation

      private void correct_generation(int pass_leng, Object[] args)
      Function that ensures that a password contains all required character types
      Parameters:
      pass_leng - integer value: length of password
      args - Object array containing password generation parameters args[0] - boolean value: use numbers or not args[1] - boolean value: use upper case or not args[2] - boolean value: use special characters or not args[3] - boolean value: use Cyrillic characters or not args[4] - integer value: length of generating password args[5] - string value: string of elements user need to get in generated password

    • check_args

      private void check_args(Object[] args) throws RuntimeException
      Parameters:
      args - Object array containing password generation parameters args[0] - boolean value: use numbers or not args[1] - boolean value: use upper case or not args[2] - boolean value: use special characters or not args[3] - boolean value: use Cyrillic characters or not args[4] - integer value: length of generating password args[5] - string value: string of elements user need to get in generated password
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - unchecked exceptions type that is used to handle incorrect user input

    • checkBoxToInt

      private int checkBoxToInt(Object checkbox)
      \
      Parameters:
      checkbox - boolean value: have parameters corresponding to the checkbox been selected by the user or not
      Returns:
      1 if checkbox is selected and 0 if not
